thread.title: Dozens of goats dead after a barn fire in Licking County
thread.title_full: Dozens of goats dead after a barn fire in Licking County

author: 10TV Web Staff
title: Dozens of goats dead after a barn fire in Licking County
text:
HARTFORD, Ohio â€” Dozens of farm animals were killed in a barn fire early Thursday morning in western
Licking County, according to fire officials.
Crews were called to a property in the village of Hartford around 5 a.m. on a report of a fire.
Hartford Fire Department Chief John Hill said firefighters were able to contain the fire within an hour but the barn was deemed a total loss.
Hill said there were no hydrants in the area and the department had to use several tanker trucks to bring in water.
More than 50 goats were killed in the fire, according to Hill. Among the deaths were approximately 26 baby goats and 30 county fair show animals.
Hill said there were no reported injuries from people on the property and no firefighters suffered injuries while battling the flames.
No other details were provided. The cause of the fire remains under investigation.
Stay with 10TV for updates on this developing story.
